citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Thalassobius (Tha.las.so′bi.us. Gr. fem. n. thalassa the sea; Gr. masc. n. bios life; N.L. masc. n. Thalassobius life form of the sea).
Slightly halophilic; no growth can be obtained without sea water or the addition of combined marine salts to the medium.
Preferred carbon sources are organic acids and amino acids.
DNA G+C content ranges from 57 to 59 mol%.
The genus is affiliated to the ‘Alphaproteobacteria’, order ‘Rhodobacterales’ and currently contains two species.
The type species is Thalassobius mediterraneus.
